intro: Veronica pyrethrina, commonly known as the common speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks. Veronica pyrethrina is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
